message.body: that line hasn't moved at all
prob wont have any movement until later
wish I was going to it
90 mins until I head to the range
probably need to get that going, huh?
conflicts too much with my enjoying the actual games
same reason I have never really like betting
end up wanting to root for one team, but needing something else
especially alte int he season like needing a player to do well against your team
that is where I just give up and really don't care
and I try not to draft people that play against my team a lot
yeah i cant do that cause i want to win fantasy
the league at home was a good league
when is the draft for your other league?
baseball has 2 weeks of reg season left
my team is in trouble right now
if you had the #1 pick in football who would you pick?
he's going to get a bazillion touches this year
he should put up great fantasy numbers
but he'll still get yards and stuff
I don't think I would take him over Chris Johnson or even Foster
i had Foster last year, so I'd be nervous of taking him back-to-back years
where is the logic in that?
so if we played a keeper league you wouldn't keep anyone?
if it was a keeper league, it would be differen
not in a keeper league though
i don't know...i'd go between the three
I just think minn oline is turrible
charlie johnson is OK, Loadholt blows (at least last year), Hutch is a shell of his former self
if Maclin is out long term (God forbid)...I'd really think of Shady as a top 5 pick
I'd have to look at his numbers from last year
charlie johnson is okay at best
don't think i would take him top 5
but think he could have a top 5 season
i'd prob go the top 3 and then to rodgers/vick/brees/brady
so you are bullish on the Vikings this year huh?
i think they might win 5-6 games
but you think mcnabb will do well
it's more like -- that is all they have
so they will put up numbers because of that
mcnabb was all the redskins had
like AP is going to get like 400 touches if he's healthy
so even if he's only at 4.4 or something...he's over 1600 total yards
bill musgrave is supposed to be running the Atlanta style offense
and look how many carries Turner gets
yeah I am sure Peterson will have a fine season
i'm thinking of it this way
McNabb I have no faith in
but is he going to play outside?
that's where I disagree...I can't believe that he is SO bad from one year...like he hit the wall and became terrible so quickly
so why was he so bad last year?
McNabb is used to the no WRs game...he's been doing it pretty much his entire career
poor shape, bad team, bad coaching, bad scheme
sure, but I am coming around the idea that reid is a genius
not doubt Reid is a great offensive mind
but given a skillset, Reid tends to get the absolute most out of his QBs
and they ahve not fared as well elsewhere
all I'm saying is that I'm not going to write DNabb off after one year--call it a leap of faith...but I'm thinking he has a solid year
granted he was much younger...but he took teams with James Thrash as the #1 to the conference championship game
I want McNabb to be good, just think he is done
Vikings should sign FredEx and all would be good
maybe Berrian has a bounce-back year?
I think they only win like 6 games
but I don't think McNabb will be the main problem there
so if they are only winning 6 games
I think Ponder is at that point
but I think McNabb will be playing well
so then that isn't a good season
maybe not in terms of wins and losses...but good QB play doesn't always win you games...look at the Chargers last year
but the team around you can f'up enough
I'm not saying he's making the Pro Bowl--just that he won't be nearly as bad as last year
and ahve the worst ST ever
I think he will be about the same
replaced at the end of the year
which is pretty much what you are saying
replaced at the end of the year (skins)
I think if he is that much better - they don't replace him and they win more than 5-6 games
again we are talking about a top 5-7 QB just a few years ago
hard to believe I'm going to be rooting for the Vikings this year
or at least for DNabb to do well
which in turn would most likely make them do well
he went from the 12th rated QB to the 24th 09-10
yeah, I think he can get back to 12-15
and if that is the case, then the Vikings are knocking on the door to the playoffs
here's one thing to think about
DNabb has protected the football at historically good rates
not until last year does he have a high turnover rate
if he gets back to that
but why would he go back?
all of his numbers and production will go back up
he has a bounce back year
more often older players that decline do not bounce back
well that is what needs to play out
but I'm not going to write him off from the jump after one horrible year when him and the coaching staff obviously had fundamental issues with each other
Berrian, Harvin, who else at WR
Schiancoe--some talent there as a pass catcher
yeah I am just thinking how do you get percy in the slot
well berrian and jenkins on the outside
dude, they have Lorenzo Booker -- championship
he was terrible int he preseason game
and I thought he was gong to be good
I have finally stopped thinkin he will be good
the Favre situation in the 2nd year was an obvious fiasco
but so much talent has left
but some of those guys are gone
yeah I guess I am speaking mostly to Hutch and Mt Mckinny
it will be interesting to watch
I'll be much more interested in Vikings and Cards game than I ever was before
Rams are going to be good
and the card d is horrible
i was surprised you pick them for the west
yeah...that was a more a Kolb pick than anything else
that division will still stink...not as bad as last year
I am pretty sure their D was worse than ours
Kolb is up in the air
Jackson most likely is not good

I wonder if Kolb will be good. I hope so. Mostly rooting for him because he was a stand-up dude and I think he got a raw deal in Philly. Shit like that happens, but I hope he does well in Arizona...and sucks against the Eagles
do you think your boy Tebow gets any starts this year?
he really needs to be traded
I think Jon Fox will just bury him
Orton seems like John Fox QB
he's not the coach for a guy like Tebow
he lost his job to injury
if he was better he would have taken his spot bak
would you rather have Vick or Kolb right now?
we've had this debate before...not going to argue it again. Agree that Vick is better. I think Kolb can play though. Felt he got a bit of a raw deal in terms of having a fair shot
so how is it a raw deal?
we haven't had this debate at all
but like I said before, this shit happens
its a raw deal when someone outplays you?
he was promised/earned the job through his apprenticeship
ifonce he came back if he was outperforming vick you don't think he would have put him back in?
I'm not arguing that Vick isn't better
and I'm happy he's the QB
but I can like other players just like I dislike other players
but how does that amount to raw deal
he was the 2nd best QB on the roster
because he got basically 3 games to prove himself as a QB after being told/promised he was the QB of the future
so all I'm saying is that I'm glad he's getting a shot with the Cards
and I hope he does well
he was given the chance to be the qb of the future
got no problem with you being glad he is getting his shot with the cards
can't agree that he got a raw deal in Philly
if he was the 1st best QB he would have played
how can you get a raw deal if you are the 2nd best qb and don't start
and you yourself agree that Vick is better

the way the Eagles set him up, I thought he deserved more of a chance at proving himself...that didn't work out. Maybe my selection of "raw deal" as a term to describe the situation is too strong...but I think he deserved more games to prove himself. Now did it work for the best for the Eagles since Vick played great? Yes -- but we are now blurring the lines of team and individual
we can just agree to disagree
the thing that happened that no one could anticipate was Mike Vick going back to Mike Vick, but even better...he's 2.0

The Eagles will be making a statement on wide receiver Jeremy Maclin tonight from Pittsburgh, according to a league source.
Read more: http://www.philly.com/philly/blogs/inq-eagles/Report-Maclin-to-rejoin-team.html#ixzz1VK39UXgG Watch sports videos you won't find anywhere else
i equate raw deal with he got screwed
it's more like he suffered individually for the team betterment
and plus I wanted to know if he could play
and in the end, he's getting his shot
and we got good compensation for him too
and hopefully a win - win for the hawks
and he is average at best
if he turns out to be a stud...will you be pissed the Hawks didn't make a run at him? or happy you didn't chance it
say he's a top 12 QB for the next 4 years
sure if he is great of course I will want him
how much you think Al Golden wishes he stuck at Temple to be JoePA's successor
I would go straight the AD
and be like give me a 10 yr contract with a 20 million dollar buy out
he definitely got a raw deal
i hope he has a PSU out clause
yeah that is a raw deal
and then basically everyone involved is gone in 6 months
so now everyone else is screwed
they need to financially hurt anyone invovled
or any AD/Coach/administrator should be bared from NCAA jobs
I bet the AD or President will be paying a bit more attention at taht point
forcing the coach to be involved
screwing golden/kids that are clean does nothing
only way dude could get friends was to buy them
i'm out bunk daddy--off to the range
